contents.item: We are told that people stay in love because of chemistry, or because they remain intrigued with each other, because of many kindnesses, because of luck. But part of it has got to be forgiveness and gratefulness.
When you forgive, you love. And when you love, God’s light shines upon you.

Forgiveness is the name of love practiced among people who love poorly. The hard truth is that all people love poorly. We need to forgive and be forgiven every day, every hour increasingly. That is the great work of love among the fellowship of the weak that is the human family.
What I cannot love, I overlook.

Love like rain, can nourish from above, drenching couples with a soaking joy. But sometimes under the angry heat of life, love dries on the surface and must nourish from below, tending to its roots keeping itself alive.
contents.owner: Paulo Coelho, By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept

contents.item: Love may forgive all infirmities and love still in spite of them: but Love cannot cease to will their removal.
contents.owner: C.S. Lewis, The Problem of Pain

contents.item: The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.
contents.owner: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

contents.item: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.
It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
contents.owner: Steve Maraboli, Life, the Truth, and Being Free

contents.item: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
contents.owner: Steve Maraboli, Life, the Truth, and Being Free

contents.item: But we can't go back. We can only go forward.
Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
contents.owner: Wil Zeus, Sun Beyond the Clouds

contents.item: Life is grace. Sleep is forgiveness. The night absolves. Darkness wipes the slate clean, not spotless to be sure, but clean enough for another day's chalking.
contents.owner: Frederick Buechner, The Alphabet of Grace

contents.item: So we forgive each other?" The crooked smile climbs up one more time. "Again?"And I look right into his eyes, right into him as far as I can see, because I want him to hear me, I want him to hear me with everything I mean and feel and say."Always," I say to him. "Every time.
contents.owner: Patrick Ness, The Ask and the Answer

contents.item: Forgiveness is not something you do for someone else; it's something you do for yourself. To forgive is not to condone, it is to refuse to continue feeling bad about an injury.
Resentment is like drinking poison and then hoping it will kill your enemies.
There isn't time, so brief is life, for bickerings, apologies, heartburnings, callings to account. There is only time for loving, and but an instant, so to speak, for that.
Humanity must forgive 'Humanity', for only then can we be Humane.
(on forgiveness) Didn't he and I stand together before an all seeing God convicted of the same murder? For I had murdered him with my heart and my tongue.
contents.owner: Corrie ten Boom, The Hiding Place: The Triumphant True Story of Corrie Ten Boom

contents.item: To be convinced in our hearts that we have forgiveness of sins and peace with God by grace alone is the hardest thing.
